org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt
Class RefinedSimulation2

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.AbstractSimulation2
      org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.RefinedSimulation2
All Implemented Interfaces:
Simulation2
public class RefinedSimulation2
extends AbstractSimulation2

This class provides an implementation of the procedure RefinedSimilarity in [Monika Rauch Henzinger, Thomas A. Henzinger, Peter W. Kopke: Computing Simulations on Finite and Infinite Graphs. FOCS 1995: 453-462] for computing the simulation relations between two automata. Note that the alphabets of the input automata must be the same and non-empty.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

Constructor Detail

RefinedSimulation2

public RefinedSimulation2(FSA aut1,
                          FSA aut2)
Constructs this object to compute the simulation relation between two automata. The two automata are assumed to have the same label position, the same alphabet type, and the same acceptance condition. The fair simulation is considered.

Parameters:
aut1 - an automaton
aut2 - an automaton

RefinedSimulation2

public RefinedSimulation2(FSA aut1,
                          FSA aut2,
                          boolean fair)
Constructs this object to compute the simulation relation between two automata. The two automata are assumed to have the same label position, the same alphabet type, and the same acceptance condition.

Parameters:
aut1 - an automaton
aut2 - an automaton
fair - indicating if the fair simulation should be considered
